document_data.caption: A map of Triboar.
document_data.name: Cart and Coin
document_data.services: Draft animals, [[horse]]s, tack and feed for sale
document_data.mainbody: The '''Cart and Coin'''  was a caravan outfitter located in the crossroad town of [[Triboar]] in the [[Dessarin Valley]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century and late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: It lay in the north of the town, between the [[Caravan campgrounds (Triboar)|west caravan campground]] and the [[Talking Troll]].
document_data.Services:
Along with caravan gear and supplies and animal feed, the store sold and exchanged [[horse]]s and draft animals; and hired out caravan guards to caravans.

In the late 1400s DR, the Cart and Coin also offered horseshoeing services.
document_data.Inhabitants: In the late 1400s DR, the store was run by married owners [[Arn Widdens|Arn]] and [[Syreen Widdens]] with their four young children. They had a half-dozen employees who fed, watered, and exercised animals, mucked out stables, and attached and removed [[horseshoe]]s.
document_data.History:
The business was in operation by the mid-1360s DR.

It was still in business after [[1485 DR]].
